questions.passage: Below is a diagram of the periodic table. Use it to answer questions 1, and 2

questions.q: Choose the correct number for each column:
In the previous diagram for the periodic table: What are the possible bonds formed between the elements?
options: Ionic bond in the molecules   $A-L$   and   $N-B$
Polar covalent bond is formed in the molecules   $X-L$   and   $B-W$
Ionic bond is formed in the molecules   $Y-W$   and   $X-W$
Polar covalent bond is formed in the molecules   $G-L$   and   $E-W$

questions.q: What is the correct choice which describes the opposite molecule? (IUPAC and common names)
From the following diagram: Which of the following choices represents the compounds $(X)$ and $(Y)$?
options: X: Secondary butyl bromide, Y: Is an isomer of di-ethyl ether
X: Its molecular formula   $C_{4}H_{9}X$, Y: Its general formula   $C_{n}H_{2n}O$
X: Its general formula   $C_{n}H_{2n}X$, Y: Its molecular formula   $C_{4}H_{9}O$

questions.q: Choose the correct sentence which describes the changes in this oxidation reduction reaction: $2KMnO_{4} + 16HCl \rightarrow 2MnCl_{2} + 5Cl_{2} + 8H_{2}O + 2KCl$
options: 5 electrons transfer from chlorine to manganese
5 electrons transfer from manganese to chlorine
10 electrons transfer from chlorine to manganese
10 electrons transfer from manganese to chlorine

questions.q: In the following reaction: $2NH_{3(g)} + 3Cl_{2(g)} \rightarrow N_{2(g)} + 6HCl_{(g)}$. If $5.0\,L$ of $NH_{3}$ react with $5.0\,L$ of $Cl_{2}$ measured at the same conditions in a closed container. The volume of the resultant gases in L will be:
A gas has a density $3.48\,g/L$ the most reasonable formula for this gas is: ($C=12, H=1$)
Which of the following can be used to prepare copper sulphate in lab?
options: Reaction of copper with dil sulphuric acid
Reaction of copper oxide with sodium sulphate solution
Reaction of copper chloride solution with sodium sulphate solution
Reaction of copper oxide with conc. sulphuric acid

questions.q: What is the molar concentration of $PbI_{2}$ in distilled water if you know that ($K_{sp} = 7.9 \times 10^{-9}$)?
The correct arrangement of the following reactions according to their rate is:
During electroplating an iron spoon with a layer of silver, which of the following statements is correct?
options: The spoon acts as cathode & concentration of silver ions in the solution decreases by time
The silver plate acts as anode and the iron ions will be reduced at cathode
The cell is considered electrolytic and the mass of anode increases
The decreasing in the anodic mass equals the increasing in cathodic mass

questions.q: Which of the following one of choices is correct?
options: $0.2\,M$   of   $Ba(OH)_{2}$   solution is less conductor than that hydrochloric acid of   $pH = 2$
$0.5\,M$   $HCN$   acid of   $K_{a} = 6.8 \times 10^{-4}$   is more conductor than that of   $BaCl_{2}$ of   $0.01\,M$
$0.5\,M$   $HCN$   acid of   $K_{a} = 6.8 \times 10^{-4}$   is less conductor than that   $0.01\,M$   acetic acid of  $K_{a} = 1.8 \times 10^{-4}$
$0.01\,M$   of sodium hydroxide is more conductor than that of   $0.01\,M$   sodium sulphate

questions.q: Which of the following statement is wrong about reversible and irreversible reactions?
options: Irreversible chemical reactions occurs only one direction.
Reversible chemical reactions can occur in both directions.
In irreversible chemical reactions, one of the reactants may be completely consumed
In reversible chemical reactions, one of the products may escape from the reaction medium

questions.q: In the following reaction: $2AB_{2(g)} \rightleftharpoons A_{2}B_{4(g)}$ ($K_{p} = 20$). The value of $K_{p}$ for decomposition of 2 moles of $A_{2}B_{4}$ equals:
The rate of a chemical reaction cannot be determined by:
options: Measuring the change in mass during the reaction
Monitoring the change of pressure acting on the reaction
Monitoring color changes during the reaction
Calculating the volume of gas produced over time

questions.q: Which one of the following substances would have the highest boiling point?
Three salts dissolved in water $(X, Y, Z)$ they give different colors with litmus solution if the color of litmus solution in $(X)$ is violet & in $(Z)$ is blue, so they will be.....

Which of the following statements is / are wrong about the rate law?
i- The rate law depends on the concentrations of reactants and their number of moles.
ii- In the rate law concentrations of the products do not appear.
iii- The value of the exponent (n) must be determined by experiment; it can be written from the balanced equation.
iv- The rate law depends on the order of a reactants only.
If $22.2\,g$ of tin precipitated on passing a current $2A$ for [x] hours in a molten of one of its compounds, so this compound is ($Sn=118.69$)
Which of the following methods can be used to separate a mixture of salt and water?
0.5 M of acetic acid diluted to 0.05M, so What do you expect about the values of: the degree of dissociation $(\alpha)$, the $[OH^{-}]$, and the $pOH$ value?

A reaction is accompanied by absorption of energy and has an activation energy of $100\,kJ/mol$, which of the following statements are correct?
(1) The reverse reaction has an activation energy equal to $100\,kJ/mol$.
(2) The reverse reaction has an activation energy less than $100\,kJ/mol$.
(3) The reverse reaction has an activation energy greater than $100\,kJ/mol$.
(4) The change in internal energy is less than zero.
(5) The change in internal energy is greater than zero.
Which of the following titration will have the end point at pH more than 7?
By adding drops of hydrochloric acid to the water, which of the following choices is correct?

What is the number of required $KMnO_{4}$ moles to oxidize one mole of ferrous sulphate completely according to the following equation? $2KMnO_{4} + 10FeSO_{4} + 8H_{2}SO_{4} \rightarrow K_{2}SO_{4} + 2MnSO_{4} + 5Fe_{2}(SO_{4})_{3} + 8H_{2}O$
From the following diagram: Hydrocarbon derivative $C_{n}H_{2n}O_{2} \xrightarrow{\text{acidic hydrolysis}} (X) + (Y)$. Which of the following choices about $(X)$ and $(Y)$ is correct?
options: X: Is an isomer of propanal, Y: Its molecular formula $C_{4}H_{9}O$
X: Its general formula $C_{n}H_{2n+2}O$, Y: Its general formula $C_{n}H_{2n}O_{2}$
X: Its molecular formula $C_{4}H_{9}O$, Y: Its general formula $C_{n}H_{2n}O$
X: Its general formula $C_{n}H_{2n}O$, Y: Is an isomer of di-methyl ether

questions.q: The following table illustrates the electric potential for some elements. Which of the following statements are correct? 1. The element B can be coated by that of A and it is called anodic protection. 2. The element C can be coated by that of B and it is called anodic protection. 3. The electrode D acts as cathode in a galvanic cell made with hydrogen electrode. 4. The cell of electrodes C and D is considered electrolytic and the electrode C is considered cathode.
Aromatic ester (used in treating headache and fever) $\xrightarrow{\text{alkaline hydrolysis}}$ Aromatic sodium salt $(X)$ + Aliphatic sodium salt $(Y)$. Which of the following choices is wrong?
options: Two moles of sodium hydroxide are required for the hydrolysis process
The molecular formula for compound (X) is $C_{7}H_{4}O_{3}Na_{2}$
The IUPAC name of the ester is acetyl salicylic acid
Compound (Y) is used to prepare simplest alkane

questions.q: Choose the correct steps to change compound $(X)$ to that of $(Y)$: $(X)$ Aliphatic compound $C_{n}H_{2n+2} \rightarrow$ can be changed to $\rightarrow (Y)$ Aromatic compound $C_{n}H_{n+1}$
options: Catalytic reformation for normal heptane - Friedel craft reaction - oxidation
Heating and sudden cooling - dropping water - trimerization.
Heating and sudden cooling - trimerization â€“ alkylation

questions.q: Study the following diagram: $(X) C_{n}H_{2n-2} \xrightarrow{\text{catalytic hydration}} (Y) C_{n}H_{2n}O \xrightarrow{\text{reduction}} (Z) C_{n}H_{2n+2}O$. If compound $(Y)$ cannot be oxidized under normal conditions. So which of the following is the correct statement?
options: $(Y)$ is isomer for Propanal - $(Z)$ is isomer for di-ethyl ether
$(X)$ is used in preparation of benzene- $(Z)$ is used to prepare methyl methanoate ester

questions.q: When equal concentrations of $H_{2}$ and $A_{2}$ are mixed, the following reaction occurs: $H_{2(g)} + A_{2(g)} \rightleftharpoons 2HA_{(g)}$. If the concentration of $HA = 1.563\,M, K_{c} = 40$, so the concentration of each of them ($H_{2}$ and $A_{2}$) equals:
Which of the following describes the properties of transition elements?
options: They have low melting points and are good conductors of heat.
They form colored compounds and have multiple oxidation states.
They are highly reactive with water and form basic oxides.
They are all found in nature in their pure elemental form.

questions.q: Which of the following is true for an exothermic reaction?
options: The enthalpy of the products is greater than the enthalpy of the reactants.
The system absorbs heat from the surroundings.
The value of $\Delta H$ is negative.
The temperature of the surroundings decreases.

questions.q: What is the primary function of a salt bridge in a galvanic cell?
options: To allow the flow of electrons between the two half-cells.
To provide a source of electrical energy.
To maintain electrical neutrality by allowing the flow of ions.
To prevent the electrodes from dissolving.

questions.q: Which functional group is present in all carboxylic acids?
According to Le Chatelier's principle, what will happen if the pressure is increased in the system: $N_{2(g)} + 3H_{2(g)} \rightleftharpoons 2NH_{3(g)}$?
options: The equilibrium will shift toward the reactants.
The equilibrium will shift toward the products.
